subject: Law
title: Slavery and the Constitution
description: A quick win: understand Slavery and the Constitution.

hook.text: The Constitution declared 'all men are created equal' while counting enslaved people as three-fifths of a person.

buildup.text: The Three-Fifths Compromise gave slave states extra congressional seats without giving enslaved people any rights.

discovery.text: The Fugitive Slave Clause required returning escaped enslaved peopleâ€”embedding slavery into the constitutional fabric.

twist.text: Dred Scott v. Sandford (1857) ruled Black people could never be citizens. It's the worst Supreme Court decision.

climax.text: The 13th, 14th, and 15th Amendments abolished slavery, granted citizenship, and protected voting rights post-Civil War.

punchline.text: The Constitution was born with a moral flaw. Fixing it cost a war.

quiz.question: What did the Three-Fifths Compromise do?
options: Counted enslaved people as three-fifths for representation
Gave three-fifths of states voting rights
